instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..
definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Turn on & off loop
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

I m working on 2011 macbook air 11" , when plug power cable machine turn on 3 seconds later off and turn on again and 3 seconds later off again ...

Disconnected every thing and replaced known good I/O board same problem.

Checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> ,<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> ,<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> and other S5 lines is stable S0 lines up 3 or 5 sec. then off. When connected mouse at usb port 2 second light is up then off then turn on again.

Also tried different bios, no sign of liquid damage. CPU is worming too much but then machine turn on in 3 second but PCH is cold.

Any suggestion :(

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Turn on & off loop
threads.message: These are the worst, could really be anything. Usually it does not "just" happen, so history is important.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Turn on & off loop
threads.message: I don't have any idea but also machine I/O board is damaged (could be relation)  after replace I/O board this problems happening ..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Turn on & off loop
threads.message: Damaged as in liquid or fucked up by idiot?
